intro: Thryallis dasycarpa, commonly known as the hairy-fruited thryallis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its woody shrub structure, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that is densely covered in hairs, giving it the common name "hairy-fruited." Thryallis dasycarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
